column4: Hello... while trying to boot up on the Kubuntu 10.04 32-bit install CD, I get the following error message: (initramfs) mount: mounting /dev/loop0 on //filesystem.squashfs failed: Input/output error    Can not mount /dev/loop0 (/cdrom/casper/filesystem.squashfs) on ///filesystem.squashfs ... I've googled around and found mostly suggestions that the image might be corrupt, but the downloaded iso's md5 checks out correctly. I
can't run the "verify disk" on the kubuntu cd because it gives the same error. Any thoughts?
download again, and do md5sum check
i just did md5sum on the iso
